sleMplsTpOam.name: sleMplsTpOam
sleMplsTpOam.contactinfo: Gyerok Kwon Dasan Networks Email: grkwon@dasannetworks.com Kantharaj B M Dasan Networks Email: kanth@dasannetworks.com DongChel Shin (Chris) Dasan Networks Email: dchshin@dasannetworks.com Comments about this document should be emailed directly to the Dasan support email ID at support@dasannetworks.com.

sleMplsTpOamMegInfoTable.name: sleMplsTpOamMegInfoTable
sleMplsTpOamMegInfoTable.description: This table contains information about the Maintenance Entity Groups (MEG). MEG as mentioned in MPLS-TP OAM framework defines a set of one or more maintenance entities (ME). Maintenance Entities define a relationship between any two points of a transport path in an OAM domain to which maintenance and monitoring operations apply.

sleMplsTpOamMegInfoEntry.name: sleMplsTpOamMegInfoEntry
sleMplsTpOamMegInfoEntry.reference: 1. RFC 5860, Requirements for OAM in MPLS Transport Networks, May 2010. 2. RFC 6371, Operations, Administration, and Maintenance Framework for MPLS-Based Transport Networks, September 2011. 3. RFC 6370, MPLS Transport Profile (MPLS-TP) Identifiers. 4. MPLS-TP Identifiers Following ITU-T Conventions [TP-ITUIDS].
sleMplsTpOamMegInfoEntry.description: An entry in this table represents MPLS-TP MEG. An entry can be created by a network administrator or by an SNMP agent as instructed by an MPLS-TP OAM Framework. When a new entry is created with sleMplsTpOamMegOperatorType set to ipCompatible (1), then as per [RFC6370] (MEG_ID for LSP is LSP_ID and MEG_ID for PW is PW_Path_ID), MEP_ID can be automatically formed. For co-routed bidirectional LSP, MEG_ID is A1-{Global_ID::Node_ID::Tunnel_Num}::Z9-{Global_ID:: Node_ID::Tunnel_Num}::LSP_Num. For associated bidirectional LSP, MEG_ID is A1- {Global_ID::Node_ID::Tunnel_Num::LSP_Num}:: Z9- {Global_ID::Node_ID::Tunnel_Num::LSP_Num} For LSP, MEP_ID is formed using, Global_ID::Node_ID::Tunnel_Num::LSP_Num For PW, MEG_ID is formed using AGI::A1- {Global_ID::Node_ID::AC_ID}:: Z9- {Global_ID::Node_ID::AC_ID}. For PW, MEP_ID is formed using AGI::Global_ID::Node_ID::AC_ID MEP_ID is retrieved from the sleMplsTpOamMegServicePointer object based on the sleMplsTpOamMegServiceType value. ICC MEG_ID for LSP and PW is formed using the objects sleMplsTpOamMegIdIcc and sleMplsTpOamMegIdUmc. MEP_ID can be formed using MEG_ID::MEP_Index.

sleMplsTpOamMegInfoIndex.name: sleMplsTpOamMegInfoIndex
sleMplsTpOamMegInfoIndex.description: Index for the conceptual row identifying a MEG within this MEG table.

sleMplsTpOamMegInfoName.name: sleMplsTpOamMegInfoName
sleMplsTpOamMegInfoName.description: Each Maintenance Entity Group has unique name amongst all those used or available to a service provider or operator. It facilitates easy identification of administrative responsibility for each MEG. IETF : MEG Name Max. 48 characters long ITUT : MEG Name Max 5 characters(Excluding /).

sleMplsTpOamMegInfoOperatorType.name: sleMplsTpOamMegInfoOperatorType
sleMplsTpOamMegInfoOperatorType.reference: 1. RFC 6370, MPLS Transport Profile (MPLS-TP) Identifiers. 2. MPLS-TP Identifiers Following ITU-T Conventions [TP-ITUIDS].
sleMplsTpOamMegInfoOperatorType.description: This object is used to set the IETF or ITUT.

sleMplsTpOamMegInfoServiceType.name: sleMplsTpOamMegInfoServiceType
sleMplsTpOamMegInfoServiceType.description: Indicates the service type for which the MEG is created. If the service type indicates lsp, the service pointer in sleMplsOamMe points to the TE tunnel table entry. If the value is pseudowire service type, the service pointer in sleMplsOamMe points to the pseudowire table entry. If the value is section service type, the service pointer in sleMplsOamMe points to a section entry.

sleMplsTpOamMegInfoMegLevel.name: sleMplsTpOamMegInfoMegLevel
sleMplsTpOamMegInfoMegLevel.description: This variable is used to for level for ITUT. When a row in this table is in active object cannot be changed.

sleMplsTpOamMegInfoOperStatus.name: sleMplsTpOamMegInfoOperStatus
sleMplsTpOamMegInfoOperStatus.description: This object specifies the operational status of the Maintenance Entity Group (MEG). This object is used to send the notification to the SNMP manager about the MEG. The value up (1) indicates that the MEG and its monitored path are operationally up. The value down (2) indicates that the MEG is operationally down. When the value of mplsOamIdMegOperStatus is up(1), all the bits of mplsOamIdMegSubOperStatus must be cleared. When the value of mplsOamIdMegOperStatus is down(2), at least one bit of mplsOamIdMegSubOperStatus must be set.

sleMplsTpOamMegControlRequest.name: sleMplsTpOamMegControlRequest
sleMplsTpOamMegControlRequest.description: the configuration commands, and user can configure functions via setting this entry as proper value.

sleMplsTpOamMegControlStatus.name: sleMplsTpOamMegControlStatus
sleMplsTpOamMegControlStatus.description: status of user command. User have to check this value as .busy. or .idle. before do setRequest.

sleMplsTpOamMegControlTimer.name: sleMplsTpOamMegControlTimer
sleMplsTpOamMegControlTimer.description: the wait-time until setRequest end. In case of short-time command, this value is 0

sleMplsTpOamMegControlTimeStamp.name: sleMplsTpOamMegControlTimeStamp
sleMplsTpOamMegControlTimeStamp.description: the time stamp of the last command. (don.t care)

sleMplsTpOamMegControlName.name: sleMplsTpOamMegControlName
sleMplsTpOamMegControlName.description: Each Maintenance Entity Group has unique name amongst all those used or available to a service provider or operator. It facilitates easy identification of administrative responsibility for each MEG.

sleMplsTpOamMegControlOperatorType.name: sleMplsTpOamMegControlOperatorType
sleMplsTpOamMegControlOperatorType.reference: 1. RFC 6370, MPLS Transport Profile (MPLS-TP) Identifiers. 2. MPLS-TP Identifiers Following ITU-T Conventions [TP-ITUIDS].
sleMplsTpOamMegControlOperatorType.description: Indicates the operator type for MEG. Conceptual rows having 'iccBased' as operator type, should have valid values for the objects sleMplsTpOamMegControlIdIcc and sleMplsTpOamMegControlIdUmc while making the row status active.

sleMplsTpOamMegControlServiceType.name: sleMplsTpOamMegControlServiceType
sleMplsTpOamMegControlServiceType.description: Indicates the service type for which the MEG is created. If the service type indicates lsp, the service pointer in sleMplsOamMe points to the TE tunnel table entry. If the value is pseudowire service type, the service pointer in sleMplsOamMe points to the pseudowire table entry. If the value is section service type, the service pointer in sleMplsOamMe points to a section entry.

sleMplsTpOamMegControlLevel.name: sleMplsTpOamMegControlLevel
sleMplsTpOamMegControlLevel.description: This variable is used to for level for ITUT. When a row in this table is in active object cannot be changed.

sleMplsTpOamMaintanceEntityInfoTable.name: sleMplsTpOamMaintanceEntityInfoTable
sleMplsTpOamMaintanceEntityInfoTable.description: This table contains MPLS-TP maintenance entity information. ME is some portion of a transport path that requires management bounded by two points (called MEPs), and the relationship between those points to which maintenance and monitoring operations apply. This table is generic enough to handle MEPs and MIPs information within a MEG.

sleMplsTpOamMaintanceEntityInfoEntry.name: sleMplsTpOamMaintanceEntityInfoEntry
sleMplsTpOamMaintanceEntityInfoEntry.description: An entry in this table represents MPLS-TP maintenance entity. This entry represents the ME if the source and sink MEPs are defined. A ME is a p2p entity. One ME has two such MEPs. A MEG is a group of one or more MEs. One MEG can have two or more MEPs. For P2P LSP, one MEG has one ME and this ME is associated two MEPs (source and sink MEPs) within a MEG. Each sleMplsOamMeIndex value denotes the ME within a MEG. In case of unidirectional point-to-point transport paths, a single unidirectional Maintenance Entity is defined to monitor it and sleMplsOamMeServicePointer points to unidirectional point-to-point path. In case of associated bidirectional point-to-point transport paths, two independent unidirectional Maintenance Entities are defined to independently monitor each direction and each sleMplsOamMeServicePointer MIB object points to unique unidirectional transport path. This has implications for transactions that terminate at or query a MIP, as a return path from MIP to source MEP does not necessarily exist within the MEG. In case of co-routed bidirectional point-to-point transport paths, a single bidirectional Maintenance Entity is defined to monitor both directions congruently and sleMplsOamMeServicePointer MIB object points to co-routed bidirectional point-to-point transport path. In case of unidirectional point-to-multipoint transport paths, a single unidirectional Maintenance entity for each leaf is defined to monitor the transport path from the root to that leaf and each leaf has different transport path information in sleMplsOamMeServicePointer MIB object.

sleMplsTpOamMaintanceEntityInfoMeIndex.name: sleMplsTpOamMaintanceEntityInfoMeIndex
sleMplsTpOamMaintanceEntityInfoMeIndex.description: Uniquely identifies a maintenance entity index within a MEG.

sleMplsTpOamMaintanceEntityInfoMpIndex.name: sleMplsTpOamMaintanceEntityInfoMpIndex
sleMplsTpOamMaintanceEntityInfoMpIndex.description: Indicates the maintenance point index, used to create multiple MEPs in a node of single ME. The value of this object can be MEP index or MIP index. Managers should obtain new values for row creation in this table by reading mplsOamIdMeMpIndexNext.

sleMplsOamMaintenanceEntityInfoMeName.name: sleMplsOamMaintenanceEntityInfoMeName
sleMplsOamMaintenanceEntityInfoMeName.description: This object denotes the ME name, each Maintenance Entity has unique name within MEG.

sleMplsTpOamMaintanceEntityInfoMpType.name: sleMplsTpOamMaintanceEntityInfoMpType
sleMplsTpOamMaintanceEntityInfoMpType.description: Indicates the maintenance point type within the MEG. The object should have the value mep (1), only in the Ingress or Egress nodes of the transport path. The object can have the value mip (2), in the intermediate nodes and possibly in the end nodes of the transport path.

sleMplsOamMaintenanceEntityInfoServiceTu.name: sleMplsOamMaintenanceEntityInfoServiceTunnelName
sleMplsOamMaintenanceEntityInfoServiceTu.description: This variable represents a pointer to the MPLS-TP transport path. This value may point at an entry in the sleMplsTunnelEntry ifsleMplsOamMaintenanceEntitygServiceType is configured as lsp (1) or at an entry in the pwEntry if sleMplsOamMaintenanceEntitygServiceType is configured as pseudowire (2). Note: This service pointer object, is placed in ME table instead of MEG table, since it will be useful in case of point-to-multipoint, where each ME will point to different branches of a P2MP tree.

sleMplsOamMaintenanceEntityInfoServiceVc.name: sleMplsOamMaintenanceEntityInfoServiceVcId
sleMplsOamMaintenanceEntityInfoServiceVc.description: This variable represents a pointer to the MPLS-TP transport path. This value may point at an entry in the sleMplsTunnelEntry ifsleMplsOamMaintenanceEntitygServiceType is configured as lsp (1) or at an entry in the pwEntry if sleMplsOamMaintenanceEntitygServiceType is configured as pseudowire (2). Note: This service pointer object, is placed in ME table instead of MEG table, since it will be useful in case of point-to-multipoint, where each ME will point to different branches of a P2MP tree.

sleMplsOamMaintenanceEntityInfoServiceDa.name: sleMplsOamMaintenanceEntityInfoServiceDatalink
sleMplsOamMaintenanceEntityInfoServiceDa.description: This variable represents a pointer to the MPLS-TP transport path. This value may point at an entry in the sleMplsTunnelEntry ifsleMplsOamMaintenanceEntitygServiceType is configured as lsp (1) or at an entry in the pwEntry if sleMplsOamMaintenanceEntitygServiceType is configured as pseudowire (2). Note: This service pointer object, is placed in ME table instead of MEG table, since it will be useful in case of point-to-multipoint, where each ME will point to different branches of a P2MP tree.

sleMplsTpOamMaintanceEntityInfoCcInterva.name: sleMplsTpOamMaintanceEntityInfoCcInterval
sleMplsTpOamMaintanceEntityInfoCcInterva.description: This variable is used to keep the continuty check interval for ITUT. When a row in this table is in active object cannot be changed.

sleMplsTpOamMaintanceEntityInfoRemoteMpI.name: sleMplsTpOamMaintanceEntityInfoRemoteMpId
sleMplsTpOamMaintanceEntityInfoRemoteMpI.description: This variable is used for setting the remote mep id

sleMplsTpOamMaintanceEntityInfoRemoteCc.name: sleMplsTpOamMaintanceEntityInfoRemoteCc
sleMplsTpOamMaintanceEntityInfoRemoteCc.reference: RFC6923, MPLS Transport Profile (MPLS-TP) Identifiers Following ITU-T Conventions. Section 3.
sleMplsTpOamMaintanceEntityInfoRemoteCc.description: Global uniqueness is assured by concatenating the ICC with a Country Code (CC). The Country Code (alpha-2) is a string of two alphabetic characters represented with upper case letters (i.e., A-Z). This object MUST contain a non-null ICC value if the MplsOamIdMegOperatorType value is iccBased(2), otherwise a null ICC value with octet size 0 should be assigned.

sleMplsTpOamMaintanceEntityInfoRemoteIcc.name: sleMplsTpOamMaintanceEntityInfoRemoteIcc
sleMplsTpOamMaintanceEntityInfoRemoteIcc.reference: RFC6923, MPLS Transport Profile (MPLS-TP) Identifiers Following ITU-T Conventions. Section 3.1.
sleMplsTpOamMaintanceEntityInfoRemoteIcc.description: Unique code assigned to Network Operator or Service Provider maintained by ITU-T. The ITU Carrier Code used to form MEGID. This object MUST contain a non-null ICC value if the MplsOamIdMegOperatorType value is iccBased(2), otherwise a null ICC value with octet size 0 should be assigned.

sleMplsTpOamMaintanceEntityInfoRemoteMeg.name: sleMplsTpOamMaintanceEntityInfoRemoteMeg
sleMplsTpOamMaintanceEntityInfoRemoteMeg.reference: RFC6923, MPLS Transport Profile (MPLS-TP) Identifiers Following ITU-T Conventions. Section 7.1.
sleMplsTpOamMaintanceEntityInfoRemoteMeg.description: Unique code assigned by Network Operator or Service Provider and is appended to mplsOamIdMegIdIcc to form the MEGID. This object MUST contain a non-null ICC value if the MplsOamIdMegOperatorType value is iccBased(2), otherwise a null ICC value with octet size 0 should be assigned.

sleMplsTpOamMaintanceEntityInfoRemoteMpd.name: sleMplsTpOamMaintanceEntityInfoRemoteMpdirection
sleMplsTpOamMaintanceEntityInfoRemoteMpd.description: Indicates the maintenance point type within the MEG. This object is used to display the forward and reverse remote mep of Transist router .

sleMplsTpOamMaintanceEntityRequest.name: sleMplsTpOamMaintanceEntityRequest
sleMplsTpOamMaintanceEntityRequest.description: the configuration commands, and user can configure functions via setting this entry as proper value.

sleMplsTpOamMaintanceEntityControlStatus.name: sleMplsTpOamMaintanceEntityControlStatus
sleMplsTpOamMaintanceEntityControlStatus.description: status of user command. User have to check this value as .busy. or .idle. before do setRequest.

sleMplsTpOamMaintanceEntityControlTimer.name: sleMplsTpOamMaintanceEntityControlTimer
sleMplsTpOamMaintanceEntityControlTimer.description: the wait-time until setRequest end. In case of short-time command, this value is 0

sleMplsTpOamMaintanceEntityControlTimeSt.name: sleMplsTpOamMaintanceEntityControlTimeStamp
sleMplsTpOamMaintanceEntityControlTimeSt.description: the time stamp of the last command. (don.t care)

sleMplsTpOamMaintanceEntityControlMegNam.name: sleMplsTpOamMaintanceEntityControlMegName
sleMplsTpOamMaintanceEntityControlMegNam.description: Uniquely identifies a maintenance entity index within a MEG.

sleMplsTpOamMaintanceEntityControlMeName.name: sleMplsTpOamMaintanceEntityControlMeName
sleMplsTpOamMaintanceEntityControlMeName.description: This object denotes the ME name, each Maintenance Entity has unique name within MEG.

sleMplsTpOamMaintanceEntityControlMepId.name: sleMplsTpOamMaintanceEntityControlMepId
sleMplsTpOamMaintanceEntityControlMepId.description: Uniquely identifies a maintenance entity index within a MEP .

sleMplsTpOamMaintanceEntityControlMpType.name: sleMplsTpOamMaintanceEntityControlMpType
sleMplsTpOamMaintanceEntityControlMpType.description: Indicates the maintenance point type within the MEG. The object should have the value mep (1), only in the Ingress or Egress nodes of the transport path. The object can have the value mip (2), in the intermediate nodes and possibly in the end nodes of the transport path.

sleMplsTpOamMaintanceEntityControlServic.name: sleMplsTpOamMaintanceEntityControlServiceValue
sleMplsTpOamMaintanceEntityControlServic.description: This variable represents a pointer to the MPLS-TP transport path. This value may point at an entry in the sleMplsTunnelEntry if sleMplsOamMeControlgServiceType is configured as lsp (1) or at an entry in the pwEntry if sleMplsOamMeControlgServiceType is configured as pseudowire (2). Note: This service pointer object, is placed in ME table instead of MEG table, since it will be useful in case of point-to-multipoint, where each ME will point to different branches of a P2MP tree.

sleMplsTpOamMaintanceEntityControlCcInte.name: sleMplsTpOamMaintanceEntityControlCcInterval
sleMplsTpOamMaintanceEntityControlCcInte.description: This variable is used to keep the continuty check interval for ITUT. When a row in this table is in active object cannot be changed.

sleMplsTpOamMaintanceEntityControlRemote.name: sleMplsTpOamMaintanceEntityControlRemoteMpId
sleMplsTpOamMaintanceEntityControlRemote.description: This variable is used for setting the remote mep id

sleMplsTpOamMaintanceEntityControlRemote.name: sleMplsTpOamMaintanceEntityControlRemoteCc
sleMplsTpOamMaintanceEntityControlRemote.reference: RFC6923, MPLS Transport Profile (MPLS-TP) Identifiers Following ITU-T Conventions. Section 3.
sleMplsTpOamMaintanceEntityControlRemote.description: Global uniqueness is assured by concatenating the ICC with a Country Code (CC). The Country Code (alpha-2) is a string of two alphabetic characters represented with upper case letters (i.e., A-Z). This object MUST contain a non-null ICC value if the MplsOamIdMegOperatorType value is iccBased(2), otherwise a null ICC value with octet size 0 should be assigned.

sleMplsTpOamMaintanceEntityControlRemote.name: sleMplsTpOamMaintanceEntityControlRemoteIcc
sleMplsTpOamMaintanceEntityControlRemote.reference: RFC6923, MPLS Transport Profile (MPLS-TP) Identifiers Following ITU-T Conventions. Section 3.1.
sleMplsTpOamMaintanceEntityControlRemote.description: Unique code assigned to Network Operator or Service Provider maintained by ITU-T. The ITU Carrier Code used to form MEGID. This object MUST contain a non-null ICC value if the MplsOamIdMegOperatorType value is iccBased(2), otherwise a null ICC value with octet size 0 should be assigned.

sleMplsTpOamMaintanceEntityControlRemote.name: sleMplsTpOamMaintanceEntityControlRemoteMeg
sleMplsTpOamMaintanceEntityControlRemote.reference: RFC6923, MPLS Transport Profile (MPLS-TP) Identifiers Following ITU-T Conventions. Section 7.1.
sleMplsTpOamMaintanceEntityControlRemote.description: Unique code assigned by Network Operator or Service Provider and is appended to mplsOamIdMegIdIcc to form the MEGID. This object MUST contain a non-null ICC value if the MplsOamIdMegOperatorType value is iccBased(2), otherwise a null ICC value with octet size 0 should be assigned.

sleMplsTpOamMaintanceEntityControlRemote.name: sleMplsTpOamMaintanceEntityControlRemoteMpDirection
sleMplsTpOamMaintanceEntityControlRemote.description: Indicates the direction of the MEP. This object should be configured if sleMplsOamMeControlMpType is configured as mep (1).

sleMplsTpOamFmInfoEntry.name: sleMplsTpOamFmInfoEntry
sleMplsTpOamFmInfoEntry.description: An entry in this table represents MPLS-TP maintenance entity.

sleMplsTpOamFmInfoMeIndex.name: sleMplsTpOamFmInfoMeIndex
sleMplsTpOamFmInfoMeIndex.description: Uniquely identifies a maintenance entity index within a MEG.

sleMplsTpOamFmInfoMpIndex.name: sleMplsTpOamFmInfoMpIndex
sleMplsTpOamFmInfoMpIndex.description: Indicates the maintenance point index, used to create multiple MEPs in a node of single ME. The value of this object can be MEP index or MIP index. Managers should obtain new values for row creation in this table by reading mplsOamIdMeMpIndexNext.

sleMplsTpOamFmInfoFaultManagement.name: sleMplsTpOamFmInfoFaultManagement
sleMplsTpOamFmInfoFaultManagement.description: Fault Managment for IETF shows enable or disable

sleMplsTpOamFmInfoRefreshTime.name: sleMplsTpOamFmInfoRefreshTime
sleMplsTpOamFmInfoRefreshTime.description: This Object is used in IETF-based Fault Management RefreshTimer.

sleMplsTpOamFmInfoLockInstruct.description: Lock instruct for IETF shows enable or disable

sleMplsTpOamFmInfoLockInstructRefreshTim.description: This Object is used in IETF-based lock RefreshTimer.

sleMplsTpOamFmInfoAlarmIndication.name: sleMplsTpOamFmInfoAlarmIndication

sleMplsTpOamFmInfoAlarmIndicationInterva.description: This is object to display the itut alarm indication interval value.

sleMplsTpOamFmInfoAlarmIndicationLevel.name: sleMplsTpOamFmInfoAlarmIndicationLevel
sleMplsTpOamFmInfoAlarmIndicationLevel.description: This object to display the Itut alarm indication Level value.

sleMplsTpOamFmInfoLock.name: sleMplsTpOamFmInfoLock
sleMplsTpOamFmInfoLock.description: This Object is used in ITUT-based lock. This object will enable/disable the lock

sleMplsTpOamFmInfoLockInterval.name: sleMplsTpOamFmInfoLockInterval
sleMplsTpOamFmInfoLockInterval.description: This object is used to display the ITUT based Lock Interval.

sleMplsTpOamFmInfoLockLevel.name: sleMplsTpOamFmInfoLockLevel
sleMplsTpOamFmInfoLockLevel.description: This object is used to Display the ITUT based Lock Level.

sleMplsTpOamFmInfoLoopBack.name: sleMplsTpOamFmInfoLoopBack
sleMplsTpOamFmInfoLoopBack.description: This Object is used in IETF-based loop back. This will show enable/disable loop back .

sleMplsTpOamFmInfoLoopBackStatus.name: sleMplsTpOamFmInfoLoopBackStatus
sleMplsTpOamFmInfoLoopBackStatus.description: This object to display the Status of IETF Based LoopBackStatus.

sleMplsTpOamFmInfoLockInstructStatus.name: sleMplsTpOamFmInfoLockInstructStatus
sleMplsTpOamFmInfoLockInstructStatus.description: This object to display the Status of IETF Based LockInstruct.

sleMplsTpOamFmInfoFaultManagementStatus.name: sleMplsTpOamFmInfoFaultManagementStatus
sleMplsTpOamFmInfoFaultManagementStatus.description: This object to display the Status of IETF Based FaultManagement.

sleMplsTpOamFmInfoCcCvStatus.name: sleMplsTpOamFmInfoCcCvStatus
sleMplsTpOamFmInfoCcCvStatus.description: This object to display the Status of IETF Based CC-CV.

sleMplsTpOamFmInfoStatus.name: sleMplsTpOamFmInfoStatus
sleMplsTpOamFmInfoStatus.description: This object is used to display the IETF Status 1- path not Associated. 2- path associated with another me. 3- path down 4- received AIS Message. 5- received LKR FM Message. 6- Bfd Detected Loc. 7- Server Layer Down. 8- Invalid Me.

sleMplsTpOamFmControlTimeStamp.description: the time stamp of the last command. (don.t care)

sleMplsTpOamFmInit.name: sleMplsTpOamFmInit
sleMplsTpOamFmInit.description: This variable is used for setting the fault Measurments for IETF/ITUT based upon gloable configuration 1) Fault measurment is for IETF 2) Lock-Instruct is for IETF 3) LoopBack to configure for IETF

sleMplsTpOamFmControlRefreshTime.name: sleMplsTpOamFmControlRefreshTime
sleMplsTpOamFmControlRefreshTime.description: This varible is used to set the Refresh Time for IETF of 2 objects ie., Fault managment and Lock Instruct 1) Fault managment range (1-20) 2) Lock-Instruct range (1-255)

sleMplsTpOamFmControlInterval.name: sleMplsTpOamFmControlInterval
sleMplsTpOamFmControlInterval.description: This variable is used to set the interval for 2 alarm-inidaction and lock objects of ITUT

sleMplsTpOamFmControlLevel.name: sleMplsTpOamFmControlLevel
sleMplsTpOamFmControlLevel.description: This varible is used to set the level for Alarm indication and lock objects of ITUT
